qas.question: From what area did the Kushan Empire come?
Who was the first ruler of the Kushan empire?
In the middle o what century did the Kushan empire begin?
What was the language base of the Kushans?
What had the Kushans conquered much of by the time of Kanishka

context: The Kushan Empire expanded out of what is now <a0_0>Afghanistan<a0_0/> into the northwest of the subcontinent under the leadership of their first emperor, <a1_0>Kujula Kadphises<a1_0/>, about the middle of the <a2_0>1st century CE<a2_0/>. They came of an <a3_0>Indo-European<a3_0/> language speaking Central Asian tribe called the Yuezhi, a branch of which was known as the Kushans. By the time of his grandson, Kanishka, they had conquered most of <a4_0>northern India<a4_0/>, at least as far as Saketa and Pataliputra, in the middle Ganges Valley, and probably as far as the Bay of Bengal.
